flawed_nl_solution:
Kate bought 7 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<7*18=216>>216 red bouncy balls.
She also bought 6 packs × 18 balls/pack = <<6*18=108>>108 yellow bouncy balls.
Kate bought 216 balls - 108 balls= <<216-108=108>>108 more red bouncy balls than yellow bouncy balls.
#### 108

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 126, not 216. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
